requirements.description:
The VET Information Branch is leading the development of a new Vocational Education and Training (VET) data collection and reporting arrangements, which will transform the national VET Data Infrastructure. VDS is a significant, complex, multi jurisdiction project that will modernise the way training activity data is collected across the VET sector. Through the application of modern digital technology, VDS will increase the availability, timeliness, and relevance of VET data for all users. The Australian Government is working with state and territory governments and the NCVER to implement the VDS program over three years. 

Working in the Program Management Office (PMO) on the VET Data Streamlining Program the team is seeking a commercial procurement and contract management advisor to assist with the complex contracts and procurements within the branch.

Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Providing advice and/or tactical engagement on contract negotiations and variations with multiple suppliers within the branch to ensure that commercial standards, procedures, and processes are applied across all commercial aspects.
  • Liaising and communicating effectively with both departmental and external stakeholders as necessary to improve the knowledge and understanding of Commonwealth Procurement rules (CPRs) and contract terms in approach to market, head agreements and work order documentation and contract management plans.
  • Work as a key member of a motivated team in a driven and agile business environment
  • Work with various stakeholders and suppliers, in a collaborative manner when undertaking procurement activities
  • Work with various stakeholders and suppliers in undertaking contract management planning and implementation.
  • Assist in the resolution of contract issues and disputes in a timely manner to minimise any impacts on the business.

****Please note we have included a new submission guide which must be completed and attached to your submission. Failure to complete this guide will result in disqualifying your submission****

Reduced Activity Period - A reduced activity period may apply where the specified personnel will not work unless the buyer has provided pre-approval in writing, which includes: • Public Holidays; and • Christmas shutdown, from 12:30 pm on the last working day before Christmas Day and reopening the first working day following the first day of January each year.

requirements.description: To meet the Digital Transformation Agency’s (DTA) requirements for ICT investment, the Commission is required to prepare a First Pass Business Case (FPBC). The Commission’s new Data and Digital Strategy (the strategy), that was completed in December 2023, informs the Commission’s options in the FPBC. It was recently discovered that the strategy does not provide the detail required by the DTA to meet the requirements of the FPBC. To translate the strategy into detailed investment options in the format required by the DTA, the Commission urgently requires ICT specialists with expertise in solutions architecture and the articulation of ICT options, cost estimates, risks, and benefits. As the Commission’s Exposure Draft (ED) is due to the Department of Social Services (DSS) on 17 February 2023, this engagement must commence immediately (commence 8 February 2023 and complete 10 February 2023) to provide time for the DTA to review the options matrix. The Director – External Budget Strategy engaged with the DTA and her Australian Public Service (APS) network to identify a suitable supplier with deep experience with the DTA and FPBC’s, a track record of delivering high quality deliverables in short time frames that meet the expectations of the DTA, understanding of the Services Australia context, and sensible daily rates. REASON Group, which is on the Buy ICT procurement panel, was recommended by several contacts. Contact was made with REASON Group yesterday to invite their interest and determine their capacity to work for three days this week. To assist the Commission complete this critical element of the FPBC, several APS senior executives will be engaged to assist with input and review of the deliverables.

requirements.description:
The Department of Veterans Affairs (DVA) has initiated a significant transformation program that is designed to address the preliminary recommendations handed down by the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide.


Through its delivery, the DVA Modernisation Program (the Program) will significantly improve the capability and interoperability of departmental systems and processes.


To support the implementation of the Program, the department has formed a new Program Delivery team within the Channel Strategy and Digital Delivery Branch. Engaging across the department and externally, the team will be responsible for the delivery of key projects under the initial phases of the Program.


There is currently an opportunity for experienced, capable and self-motivated professionals to join the Program Delivery team and make a significant and meaningful contribution to the lives of veterans.

requirements.description:
The VET Information Branch is leading the development of a new Vocational Education and Training (VET) data collection and reporting arrangements, which will transform the national VET Data Infrastructure. VDS is a significant, complex, multi jurisdiction project that will modernise the way training activity data is collected across the VET sector. Through the application of modern digital technology, VDS will increase the availability, timeliness, and relevance of VET data for all users. The Australian Government is working with state and territory governments and the NCVER to implement the VDS program over three years. 

Working in the Program Management Office (PMO) on the VET Data Streamlining Program the team is seeking a commercial procurement and contract management advisor to assist with the complex contracts and procurements within the branch.

Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Providing advice and/or tactical engagement on contract negotiations and variations with multiple suppliers within the branch to ensure that commercial standards, procedures, and processes are applied across all commercial aspects.
  • Liaising and communicating effectively with both departmental and external stakeholders as necessary to improve the knowledge and understanding of Commonwealth Procurement rules (CPRs) and contract terms in approach to market, head agreements and work order documentation and contract management plans.
  • Work as a key member of a motivated team in a driven and agile business environment
  • Work with various stakeholders and suppliers, in a collaborative manner when undertaking procurement activities
  • Work with various stakeholders and suppliers in undertaking contract management planning and implementation.
  • Assist in the resolution of contract issues and disputes in a timely manner to minimise any impacts on the business.

****Please note we have included a new submission guide which must be completed and attached to your submission. Failure to complete this guide will result in disqualifying your submission****

requirements.description: To meet the Digital Transformation Agency’s (DTA) requirements for ICT investment, the Commission is required to prepare a First Pass Business Case (FPBC). The Commission’s new Data and Digital Strategy (the strategy), that was completed in December 2023, informs the Commission’s options in the FPBC. It was recently discovered that the strategy does not provide the detail required by the DTA to meet the requirements of the FPBC. To translate the strategy into detailed investment options in the format required by the DTA, the Commission urgently requires ICT specialists with expertise in solutions architecture and the articulation of ICT options, cost estimates, risks, and benefits. As the Commission’s Exposure Draft (ED) is due to the Department of Social Services (DSS) on 17 February 2023, this engagement must commence immediately (commence 8 February 2023 and complete 10 February 2023) to provide time for the DTA to review the options matrix. The Director – External Budget Strategy engaged with the DTA and her Australian Public Service (APS) network to identify a suitable supplier with deep experience with the DTA and FPBC’s, a track record of delivering high quality deliverables in short time frames that meet the expectations of the DTA, understanding of the Services Australia context, and sensible daily rates. REASON Group, which is on the Buy ICT procurement panel, was recommended by several contacts. Contact was made with REASON Group yesterday to invite their interest and determine their capacity to work for three days this week. To assist the Commission complete this critical element of the FPBC, several APS senior executives will be engaged to assist with input and review of the deliverables.

There is currently an opportunity for experienced, capable and self-motivated professionals to join the Program Delivery team and make a significant and meaningful contribution to the lives of veterans.

requirements.description:
The Inspector-General of Intelligence and Security (IGIS) is central to the independent oversight of the Australian intelligence and security agencies. The IGIS is an independent statutory office holder who reviews the activities of Australia’s intelligence and security agencies to ensure they act legally and with propriety, comply with ministerial guidelines and directives, and respect human rights. 

As a small portfolio agency, we are a flexible and positive team. We offer a rewarding and inclusive environment in which we recruit and retain highly capable, motivated professionals with high levels of integrity and personal drive. 

This position is located in the IGIS Finance, Security, Technology and Information Governance (STIG) Section. The STIG Section is responsible for delivering a number of key services and systems including ICT. Within STIG, a small ICT team is responsible for managing all of IGIS’s information technology systems and requirements.

The ICT Systems and Support Officer will play a proactive role in maintaining and troubleshooting IGIS’s IT systems and enterprise applications, whilst providing professional IT assistance to IGIS staff and maintaining effective relationships with ICT and application service providers and other stakeholders.

Key responsibilities of the ICT Systems and Support Officer role are to:

  • Provide first, and limited second, level desktop support to staff, including setup of ICT systems
  • Support and assist in the day-to-day support of the office’s IC systems
  • Performing daily health checks and monitoring of ICT issues
  • Resolve technical support issues, problem identification and assistance
  • Management and use of hardware including desktops, laptops and mobile phones
  • Liaise with service providers to ensure timely and effective resolutions to issues
  • Develop and maintain accurate network documentation, review and update current IT processes and procedures

Essential Skills

  •  Must be an Australian citizen and able to obtain and maintain a Positive Vetting security clearance
  • Demonstrated experience in supporting and maintaining Microsoft products and platforms
  • Ability to analyse and optimise business processes
  • Ability to troubleshoot IT issues and support customer needs
  • Demonstrate initiative and responsibility
  • Highly effective in managing multiple, concurrent activities, while understanding and managing priorities, dependencies and risk

requirements.description: Who we are:  In late 2020, as part of Busting Congestion for Agricultural Exporters the Trade Reform and Digital Trade Initiatives divisions were established to develop and deliver the vision and strategy for agricultural exports, and to coordinate the range of the export business and digital reform programs that are currently underway. At the heart of this reform package is the modernisation of export systems by building Digital Services to Take Farmers to Markets. The Role: The Department is building significant digital capability within the Congestion Busting Program. They seek a Service Designer to join a multi-disciplinary team to identify how services being developed can better meet the user needs. Given the nature of this transformation, it is important that the Service Designer enables an environment that makes the prescribed services usable, easy and desirable.  A strong focus on researching customer/user behaviour and common responses is critical to creating new processes that aligns user, business and technology needs that will deliver effective digital capability. Key responsibilities:  Engage and collaborate across the program to inform the end-to-end journey of services across transactions, products, content and business processes. This role will have a strong collaborative focus on bringing the digital and regulatory processes together specifically in the context of service design. Collaborate with user researchers and stakeholders to form the bigger strategic picture. Collaborate to build on and evolve existing strategies and if identified, developing new strategies for improvements across the service design. Identify and prototype concepts to transform the service based on user needs. Work in an agile manner to deliver design and research activities Work to the Service Design and Delivery Process and Digital Service Standard Develop effective user experience design and accessibility  Skills & Experience  Extensive experience in service design and service strategy for large scale transformations Demonstrable experience in solving complex problems based on evidence, analysis and investigation Strong track record working in agile and multi-disciplinary teams Human Centred Design approach to service delivery The ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences Influencing and guiding decisions with senior stakeholders Excellent knowledge and experience in creating quality visual materials and journey maps

requirements.description:
Introduction

The Defence Science and Technology Group delivers world class Science and Technology research activities to support the defence of Australia and its national interests. Increasingly, these research activities are being digitally transformed, and rely on a rapidly growing volume of unique digital environments tailored to support leading edge technology and capability innovation.

Digital Science, Scientific Computing (DSSC) are seeking an organisation that can assist with the delivery of our ICT project portfolio to develop unique digital environments to support research in laboratories and deployed field settings.

Scope

Work with us in DSSC as part of an integrated delivery capability to support the delivery of our project portfolio. The scope of your support includes Program/ Project Management, Business Analysis, Project Analysis/ support and technical/ security engineering. Support delivery of the following projects in accordance with agreed project plans, project schedules and DSSC project methodology:

  • Compute – Virtualisation
  • Service Management Uplift
  • Integrated Research Data Storage Uplift
  • Research Trials Networks
  • HPC Onboarding and Migration
  • Collaborative Compute

requirements.description:
Mandatory Requirement

  • As part of the eligibility and suitability requirement, NDIA seeks specified personnel who are Australian citizens.
  • Applicable for ACT, VIC and QLD: Labour hire licences are required in the state that specified personnel are being contracted.


The First Nations Strategy is the NDIA’s public commitment to working alongside First Nations people with disabilities, their families and their communities, to achieve outcomes from the NDIS on an equal basis with the broader population.

The First Nations Strategic Advisor is a specialist level expert advisor position for 12 months, with potential extension, working 3-5 days per week.

The First Nations Strategic Advisor will play a critical role in providing strategic guidance, subject matter expertise, and cultural competency to support the development of the NDIA’s First Nations Strategy. 

This role is suitable for a candidate who identifies as First Nations or alternatively, has delegated authority by First Nations elders to speak on behalf of First Nations communities. An essential criteria would be filling one of these options.

The position can be full or part time. 0.6, 0.8 and FTE will all be considered.

Please refer to PD for further details.

The seller will develop the data infrastructure drawing from contemporary patterns (e.g., mesh, fabric, lake and warehouse) for platforms and products in a multi-cloud environment, featuring large-scale AWS, Azure and Oracle implementations. This will leverage our distributed large-scale data holdings across multiple cloud platforms and on-premises infrastructure.

In order to maximise the collective benefits and return of investment these capabilities and projects offer, the branch is seeking an experienced Business Architect to drive the development of strategic business architecture artefacts and processes. The role includes, but is not limited to:
